channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13333] Renew Scanner Lease without advancing the RegionScanner
item.description:
We have a usecase (for Phoenix) where we want to let the server know that the client is still around. Like a client-side heartbeat.

Doing a full heartbeat is complicated, but we could add the ability to make scanner call with caching set to 0. The server already does the right thing (it renews the lease, but does not advance the scanner).

It looks like the client (ScannerCallable) also does the right thing. We cannot break ResultScanner before HBase 2.0, but we can add a renewLease() method to AbstractClientScaner. Phoenix (or any other caller) can then cast to ClientScanner and call that method to ensure we renew the lease on the server.

It would be a simple and fully backwards compatible change. James Taylor

Comments?
item.summary: Renew Scanner Lease without advancing the RegionScanner

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This would be awesome. Too many folks are writing in lately with flavors of timeout expired exception questions.

Too many folks are writing in lately with flavors of timeout expired exception questions.

We're also (hopefully) addressing this in the other direction too with HBASE-13090. Would be good to enable keepalives from either/both directions.

0.98 patch illustrate the idea and the API.
Automated heartbeating at the client would require more threads (or intricate control logic), but in any case this could be the mechanism to renew a lease.
In trunk, I'd add this method to ResultScanner.

Any comments on the patch? Worth doing? I think on the client we want the caller responsible for handling this (rather than a background thread that pings the server - which we might forget about, or that might continue to ping when the caller forgets to close the scanner, etc).

Worth doing?

Yes.

I think on the client we want the caller responsible for handling this (rather than a background thread that pings the server

Agree
HBASE-8157 proposed scanner.progress() as new API rather than scanner.renewLease() that I propose here. I am notoriously bad at naming methods. Any opinions? Bryan Beaudreault

Thanks Lars Hofhansl, I actually think your name is better. Back then I was thinking of this more from the POV of hadoop (which has a context.progress()) method. But this name actually makes more sense in an HBase context IMO.
Cool, then let's move forward with this and close the other as a dup.

Dropped the ball on this.
Any qualms with committing this? 100% wire compatible.
Go for it!

Lars Hofhansl It came up at last night's meetup. We named it the 'coffee break' You don't have to do anything serverside? This for 0.98 only? The implementation at least. Jonathan Lawlor how would this work post your scanner fixups?
Change LGTM, don't see any reason why it would conflict with any of the recent scanner fixes. Sounds like a nice feature!

Cool... I'll commit to 0.98, 1.x.y first (since I know this is the only way to make it work there and be 100% backwards compatible).

In trunk, should we make this explicit in the protocol? I.e. add a new bit in PB to indicate that we would just like to renew the lease?
(as the "client-server-scan-size gate" showed, going by assumption and deriving state from proxies can be dangerous)
Or commit to trunk too, and file a followup.

Ideally we'd add this to ResultScanner...? So the cast is not necessary.
I would have two concerns:

  1. It would leak some implementation
  2. Could only do in trunk, right? Otherwise we might break somebody who implemented ResultScanner directly

I'd say I'd do it in trunk only.

Master patch. No new PB (torn on that, we can caching of 0 can somewhat naturally mean "don't progress").

  • Adds API to ResultScanner
  • Fixes rest/tests accordingly
Pushed -master patch to master, the 0.98 version to all other branches (1.0, 1.1, and 1.2)
